results.question: How does a non-employee director receive his/her restricted stock unit award or option grant?
gold_answer: on the date of his or her initial appointment to the Board of Directors equal to the pro-rated amount of the annual grant
results.markdown_table_response:
A director who has not exercised his or her option to purchase shares of stock in the company, or who has not exercised his or her option to receive a cash award for his or her stock-based compensation, receives the pro-rated amount of the annual stock grant.
The pro-rated amount of the annual stock grant for a non-employee director is equal to the pro-rated amount of the annual grant to the director of a restricted stock unit award, option grant or stock option (or any pro-rated stock-based compensation for directors initially appointed between annual meetings), multiplied by the pro-rated amount of the stock grant (or any pro-rated stock-based compensation for directors initially appointed between annual meetings).
results.csv_string_response: In accordance with ASC 718, a non-employee director will receive a restricted stock unit award or option grant on the date of his or her initial appointment to the Board of Directors equal to the pro-rated amount of the annual grant. The pro-rated amount of the annual grant is the amount that would have been paid to the director based on the director’s current annual salary, in the absence of any other benefit or compensation.

results.question: How is Basic earnings per share, or EPS calculated?
gold_answer: by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period, without consideration for common stock equivalents.
results.markdown_table_response: The table below presents the calculation of Basic earnings per share:
results.csv_string_response:
Basic earnings per share, or EPS, is computed by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period, without consideration for common stock equivalents. Diluted EPS is computed by dividing net income by the weighted-average number of dilutive common stock equivalents outstanding for the period and the weighted-average number of common stock equivalents outstanding for the period determined using the treasury-stock method.
For purposes of this calculation, common stock options, restricted stock units and restricted stock awards are considered to be common stock equivalents and are only included in the calculation of diluted EPS when their effect is dilutive. In periods in which the Company has a net loss, dilutive common stock equivalents are excluded from the calculation of diluted EPS.
results.json_rows_response: This is a very simple question. Basic earnings per share, or EPS, is calculated by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period, without consideration for common stock equivalents. Diluted EPS is computed by dividing net income by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding for the period and the weighted-average number of dilutive common stock equivalents outstanding for the period determined using the treasury-stock method.
